CONJUGATES: paraphrases (v.3rd sg.pres) | paraphrased (v.past, v.pp) | paraphrasing (v.pres.p) | paraphrases (n.pl)
ETYMOLOGY: Late Middle English, from Old French *paraphrase* or late Latin *paraphrasis*, from Greek *paraphrasis* 'an additional statement', from *paraphrazein* 'to tell in other words', from *para-* 'beside' + *phrazein* 'to tell'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: transitive verb: a verb that takes one or more objects
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To express the meaning of something written or spoken using different words, especially to achieve greater clarity.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 用不同的词语表达书面或口头内容的意义，特别是为了更清晰。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please paraphrase the main points of the article in your own words.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请用你自己的话转述文章的要点。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: countable noun: a noun that can be counted and has a plural form
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A restatement of a text or passage giving the meaning in another form, as for clearness; a rewording.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 对一段文本或语段的改写，以不同的形式表达其意义，以求清晰；一种意译。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His summary was actually a lengthy paraphrase of the original text.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他的总结实际上是对原文冗长的意译。
